title: Second_Quarto_File
text:
Code
# Working with the Flights Data Set
avg_delay <- flights %>%
  filter(arr_delay > 0) %>%
  group_by(origin) %>% 
  summarise(avg_delay_total = mean(arr_delay, na.rm = TRUE)) %>% 
  ungroup()

plot_ly(avg_delay, type='barpolar', r=~avg_delay_total, theta=~origin, color=~origin) %>%  
  layout(
    title = "2013 NYC Flight Average Arrival Delays",
    polar = list(
      radialaxis = list(title = "Number of Delays"),
      angularaxis = list(categoryarray = flights$origin)
    )
  )







Okay technically this isn’t a pie chart so I should be good… right? Originally I wanted to to do a racial bar chart but I could not find anything on plotly and ggplot didn’t work like I wanted it to. I’d love to learn if there is a way to create it if you have any tips.
